intro: Oenanthe carviformis, commonly known as the caraway-leaved water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive, slightly carroty scent, while its flowers are arranged in umbels. Oenanthe carviformis is often found in riparian habitats and is adapted to wet environments.
